sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Skillsoft links edX courses to corporate AI skills
feed.summary: Skillsoft has announced a partnership with edX, integrating university-developed courses from institutions like Oxford and Harvard into its corporate learning platform, Percipio. This collaboration aims to better align academic content with corporate skills planning and tracking, especially in response to the growing impact of artificial intelligence on jobs. The integration will provide organisations with an expanded catalogue of essential courses, enhancing workforce readiness and enabling employers to track skill development more effectively.

feed.title: Skillsoft links edX courses to corporate AI skills
feed.summary: Skillsoft has partnered with edX to integrate university-developed courses from institutions like Oxford and Harvard into its corporate learning platform, Percipio. This collaboration aims to better connect academic learning with corporate skills planning and tracking, especially as artificial intelligence reshapes job roles. The partnership allows employers to leverage high-quality educational content to identify, develop, and track essential AI-related skills across their workforce.

feed.title: 20251223 Responsive Playbooks and the SKIL Inflection
feed.summary: This article analyzes Skillsoft Corp. Class A (NASDAQ: SKIL), highlighting strong near-term sentiment but persistent mid and long-term weakness. It identifies an exceptional short setup targeting 40.6% downside with minimal risk, and outlines three distinct AI-generated trading strategies for various risk profiles. The analysis also includes multi-timeframe signal analysis with support and resistance levels.

feed.title: Oxford and Harvard courses head to workplaces in new edX–Skillsoft deal
feed.summary: Skillsoft (SKIL) has partnered with edX to integrate university-led courses, including those from Oxford and Harvard, into Skillsoft's AI-native skills management platform. This collaboration aims to help organizations enhance their workforce readiness for an AI-driven world by providing access to high-quality academic learning and connecting skill development to business outcomes. The partnership addresses the challenge of organizations lacking clear visibility into workforce capabilities and skill gaps highlighted by Skillsoft's 2025 Global Skills Intelligence Survey.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Skillsoft Q3 2025 sees revenue dip, strategic focus on AI
feed.summary: Skillsoft (SKIL) reported a 6% year-over-year revenue decrease to $129 million and a 12% drop in adjusted EBITDA for Q3 2025. Despite financial challenges, the company is strategically focusing on AI-driven innovations and restructuring, including a review of its Global Knowledge segment, with its new AI-driven Principio platform expected for general availability in Q1 FY27. The stock saw a slight aftermarket increase, reflecting investor optimism about its strategic shift towards AI in talent development.

feed.title: Understanding the Setup: (SKIL) and Scalable Risk
feed.summary: This article analyzes Skillsoft Corp. Class A (NASDAQ: SKIL), indicating weak sentiment across all horizons and elevated downside risk. It provides three AI-generated trading strategies—Position Trading, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging—along with multi-timeframe signal analysis, including support and resistance levels.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Skillsoft Q3 2025 sees revenue dip, strategic focus on AI By Investing.com
feed.summary: Skillsoft (SKIL) reported a Q3 2025 revenue decrease of 6% year-over-year, to $129 million, with adjusted EBITDA down 12%. The company is strategically addressing financial challenges by focusing on AI-driven innovations, restructuring, and exploring alternatives for its Global Knowledge segment. Despite the dip, Skillsoft remains optimistic, highlighting its 74.6% gross profit margin and positive aftermarket stock reaction following the earnings call.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Skillsoft Q3 2025 sees revenue dip, strategic focus on AI
feed.summary: Skillsoft (SKIL) reported a 6% year-over-year revenue decrease to $129 million in Q3 2025, primarily due to declines in its Global Knowledge segment and B2C learner product. Despite this, the company saw a positive aftermarket stock reaction and is strategically focusing on AI-driven innovations with its new Principio platform, expected to be generally available in Q1 FY27, and is exploring alternatives for its Global Knowledge segment. Skillsoft aims for future growth by aligning with market shifts towards AI-driven skills management and maintaining strong profitability in its Talent Development Solutions segment.

feed.title: Revenues Working Against Skillsoft Corp.'s (NYSE:SKIL) Share Price Following 38% Dive
feed.summary: Skillsoft Corp.'s share price has recently fallen by 38%, capping a 45% decline over the past year. The company's low price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 0.1x is attributed to its declining revenue, which decreased by 2.3% in the last year and 28% over three years. Analysts forecast a further 1.2% revenue decrease for the next year, contrasting with an expected 6.3% industry growth, which justifies the low P/S ratio and suggests a difficult period for the stock.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Skillsoft Q3 2025 sees revenue dip, strategic focus on AI
feed.summary: Skillsoft (SKIL) reported a 6% year-over-year revenue decrease to $129 million in Q3 2025, with adjusted EBITDA falling by 12% to $28 million. Despite financial challenges, the company is strategically focusing on AI-driven innovations and restructuring, including exploring alternatives for its Global Knowledge segment. Skillsoft remains optimistic about future growth, highlighted by a positive aftermarket stock reaction and projected TDS revenue of $400-$410 million for FY26.

feed.title: Skillsoft Corp.'s (NYSE:SKIL) Share Price Is Matching Sentiment Around Its Revenues
feed.summary: Skillsoft Corp.'s stock (NYSE:SKIL) has a low price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 0.3x, significantly below the Professional Services industry average, indicating investor concern. Recent financial performance shows revenue decline over the past year and three years, which is expected to continue with a forecast 1.2% decrease, while the broader industry grows by 7.0%. This poor revenue outlook justifies the low P/S ratio and suggests that without significant improvement, the stock price is unlikely to see substantial gains.

feed.title: Skillsoft Corp. (SKIL) Q2 Earnings Beat Estimates
feed.summary: Skillsoft Corp. (SKIL) reported Q2 earnings of $0.92 per share, significantly surpassing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of a $2.1 per share loss, marking an earnings surprise of +143.81%. Despite missing revenue estimates slightly with $128.82 million, the company has consistently beaten EPS expectations over the last four quarters. Investors are now looking to management commentary on the earnings call for insights into the stock's future performance.

feed.title: Skillsoft Reports Financial Results for the Second Quarter of Fiscal 2026
feed.summary: Skillsoft Corp. announced its financial results for the second quarter of fiscal 2026, reporting a total revenue of $129 million, a 3% decrease from the prior year, despite a fourth consecutive quarter of revenue growth in its Talent Development Solutions enterprise segment. The company delivered an Adjusted EBITDA of $28 million and revised its full-year revenue guidance to $510 million – $530 million due to economic uncertainties affecting discretionary live training demand. Skillsoft also highlighted advancements in AI integration and partnerships, aiming to accelerate its strategy in talent development.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Skillsoft Q2 2025 sees revenue dip amid macro challenges
feed.summary: Skillsoft (SKIL) reported a Q2 2025 revenue decline of 2.6% to $128.8 million, with adjusted EBITDA remaining flat at $28.3 million, impacted by macroeconomic uncertainties affecting discretionary training spending, particularly in its Global Knowledge segment. The company adjusted its full-year revenue guidance to $510-$530 million but maintained its adjusted EBITDA and free cash flow guidance due to cost optimization and strategic investments. Skillsoft is focusing on AI-driven learning and enterprise customers, with CEO Ron Hovsepian confident in returning to growth within 12-18 months despite persistent macro challenges.

feed.title: Investors Don't See Light At End Of Skillsoft Corp.'s (NYSE:SKIL) Tunnel And Push Stock Down 26%
feed.summary: Skillsoft Corp.'s stock has dropped 26% in the last month, despite a 103% increase over the past year. The company's price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 0.3x is significantly lower than the industry average, largely due to a revenue decline of 3.8% in the past year and a projected growth of only 0.3% next year, compared to the industry's 6.9%. Investors remain wary due to underwhelming revenue forecasts, contributing to the low P/S ratio and hindering stock price improvement.

feed.title: Is Skillsoft (NYSE:SKIL) Using Debt Sensibly?
feed.summary: Skillsoft Corp. (NYSE:SKIL) has a significant debt load, with net debt of US$492.8m and total liabilities of US$732.6m exceeding its cash and near-term receivables. The company reported an EBIT loss of US$52m and a revenue contraction of 3.8% in the last year, indicating financial risk despite a reduction in debt. Shareholders are cautioned to monitor the balance sheet closely as the company is low on liquid assets and sustained a US$336m loss in the previous year.

feed.title: Skillsoft Wins AI Excellence Award for CAISY™; Unveils New AI-Driven Coaching Features
feed.summary: Skillsoft (NYSE: SKIL) has been honored with a 2024 AI Excellence Award by Business Intelligence Group for its AI-powered coaching solution, CAISY™. The company is expanding CAISY with over 60 new coaching scenarios and a customized offering to enhance communication skills and leadership development. These new features aim to help employees navigate complex workplace challenges and foster a more resilient and collaborative workforce.

feed.title: Skillsoft Reports Financial Results for the Fourth Quarter and Full Year of Fiscal 2024
feed.summary: Skillsoft Corp. announced its financial results for the fourth quarter and full fiscal year ended January 31, 2024, reporting full-year Adjusted EBITDA above its outlook range and accelerated revenue growth in its subscription-based Content & Platform segment. The company also provided its financial outlook for full year fiscal 2025, highlighting its focus on AI opportunities and workforce transformation. Key metrics include a 4% increase in Content & Platform GAAP Revenue for Q4 and 5% for the full year, alongside a considerable GAAP net loss for both periods due to impairment charges.

feed.title: Why Investors Shouldn't Be Surprised By Skillsoft Corp.'s (NYSE:SKIL) 28% Share Price Plunge
feed.summary: Skillsoft Corp.'s shares have plummeted 28% in the last month, contributing to a 78% loss over the past twelve months. The company's low price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 0.1x, significantly below the industry average, is attributed to backwards revenue growth and a forecast of weaker future growth compared to the professional services industry. Investors are not expected to see a strong share price recovery soon due to these underlying issues.

feed.title: Skillsoft Announces General Availability of Conversation AI Simulator CAISY™ to Build More Effective Business Leaders
feed.summary: Skillsoft has announced the general availability of CAISY™ (Conversation AI Simulator), an AI-powered skills trainer that uses OpenAI's technology to create a safe environment for employees to practice workplace conversations and develop communication skills. This tool offers personalized feedback and recommends tailored courseware. Alongside CAISY, Skillsoft is introducing new offerings including Aspire Journeys, Skill Benchmarks for generative AI, and an expanded curriculum on the ethical use of AI to help organizations address skills gaps and responsibly integrate AI.

feed.title: Cornerstone to acquire SumTotal from Skillsoft for $200 million
feed.summary: Skillsoft has entered into a definitive agreement to sell its SumTotal business to Cornerstone OnDemand, Inc. for approximately $200 million in a cash transaction. This divestiture allows Skillsoft to align and simplify its portfolio, focusing on core transformative learning experiences. The company plans to use a portion of the net proceeds to partially repay its senior secured term loan B facility.

feed.title: Codecademy sends it with Skillsoft in a $525M deal
feed.summary: Codecademy, a coding class platform, has been acquired by Skillsoft for $525 million in cash and stock, marking further consolidation in the edtech sector. This acquisition allows Codecademy to leverage Skillsoft's extensive B2B presence, aiming to create a comprehensive technical learning platform for both individual and corporate learners. The deal follows Codecademy's shift towards enterprise customers and Skillsoft's recent emergence from bankruptcy and public debut via a SPAC.
